intro: Pentacalia xavialba, commonly known as the Xavialba pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help protect it from harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
